definition: to be all the same way (literary)

sentences.english: Stop and think before making the decisions, well, seems to work in all countries the history.
sentences.chinese: 先靜下來，好好思考，再做決定，看來古今中外皆然。

sentences.english: Two radical prescriptions based on people's notion perspective.
sentences.chinese: 基於人的觀念得到兩種皆然不同的手段。

sentences.english: This is true in both America and Asia.
sentences.chinese: 並非不尋常，在亞洲和美國皆然。

sentences.english: They are presenting two diametrically opposed versions of Paul.
sentences.chinese: 兩者表現了兩個皆然相反的保羅。

sentences.english: It happens all the time around the world.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況舉世皆然，經常發生。

sentences.english: I pledge my life and honor to the SST, for this night and all the nights to come.
sentences.chinese: 我將生命與榮耀獻於死死團，今夜如此，夜夜皆然。

sentences.english: I considered that of all ages literati despised each other.
sentences.chinese: 認爲是文人相輕自古皆然的事。

sentences.english: This applies to everything in life, not just dating.
sentences.chinese: 人生中事事皆然，不只是約會。

definition: none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
equally true for (all the rest)/the same thing applies (for everyone)
that being the case/then/in that case
